Modernity
Intro, Enlightenment
Captain Jack ideology
Constitution, Democratic Social Space
WWI shift; anxiety, detachment
$ over craft, indie over group (challenged by Dep. Unions), Chaplin sees harm, Rivera shift to communal, but tech, advancement
Work hard, indie, not working for blacks
Sec cap dem will win, intrinsically better, expansion of bureaurcracy
Distinction between garden suburbs and new ones: indie, meritocracy, cap, privacy, also anxiety--fight Communism, fear of bomb
Indie meritocracy a sham; cap only benefitting few at expense of many
Myth of suburbs as indie, private, self-reliant when still reliant on city/public resources, City on a Hill, Morning in America

American Myth
Meaning
Captain Jack/Natives & Enslaved
Toqueville's description, Constitution, Democratic Social Space, African Americans, new immigrants
Based more on capitalism
Fordism, 5$, meritocracy, social mobility, Dep. Threatens, Chaplin sees it over in city, Rivera shift to socialist unity
Sweet trying, but prevented, white wealth in homes; Myrdal dilemma
Work, democracy, indie win the war, for women too, proves Am myth correct, despite inequalities
Work to deserve suburban life? Private cap to fight Cold War (domestic containment) Colour-blind myth of meritocracy (Lassiter); updates and reinforces Toqueville
Uprisings reaction to being left out and oppressed to allow it, expose lies and fissures--Kerner points out foundational flaws
Myth of suburbs as indie, private, self-reliant when still reliant on city/public resources, City on a Hill, Morning in America, urban renewal projects to improve?
Megastructures--growing cap, indie, HP--diversity, social mobility
"Frontier"
Meaning
Ways of Seeing "Frontier" in NA, Detroit
Toqueville's description, not really wilderness, African Americans, new immigrants
Wealth in city for "everyone"
Ford Manual for new immigrants, Chaplin leave city, Rivera re-vamp city as unified
Blacks moving into white neighbourhoods? Possibility of integrated space?
Win war against fascism, emerge world power
Suburbs as frontier (supported by public-private works that make it easy, yet stressful); Am as world power fight Cold War
Burn it down, create something new (Black Power), rebellion?
New frontier is decentralized cities, leave central city, City on a Hill, Urban renewal projects, Chaplin leaving? Walk away from Omelas?
Edge cities, Different ways of seeing (HP) frontier? Moving back to city among young (gentrification)
Berger/Frisch
Intro, apply to typologies
Euro settlers try to break from past, become "Designer"
Different groups breaking from/living with past?
Truly break from past, implications
Chaplin break, Rivera live with: implications
Blacks try to break from past, prevented from doing so
Break from past by winning the war, democracy, new gender roles, seems to be good, but implications
Whites break from city, painful past for futurama free of crime, non-whites, means of fighting bomb fears
Blacks cannot forget (rock), implications for trying to forget, Kerner "reminds" whites, but fails
Attempt to break further from past in decade of malaise, neo-lib revolution attempts further, walk away from Omelas?
Younger people want to remember past not forget, megastructures attempt to break, though ren cen also a form of memory
Active Agent
Create more promising future than painful past
Suburb layout and exclusivity maps race, gender, family
Racial oppression seen in city falling apart
Shape of city shapes racial, class, to some extent gender divisions, urban renewal projects
Buildings keep people without $ out, HP includes everyone
Designer People
Modernity creates freedom, break from past (for some)
Toqueville's description, achieved, Democratic Social Space, Constitution, African Americans, new immigrants
Re-make, wealth, meritocracy, literally re-make yourself
Chaplin: leave city; Rivera: city socialist, communal
Af Ams? Black Bottom? Moving out like Sweets?
Win war, achieve futurama, women's identities
Suburban people making new life? What Chaplin wanted?
Blacks trying? Whites only see themselves as Designer? Riot or rebellion?
Peripheral, neo-libs remake as separate from 60s, Black Power communities without support, women's lib
Both are kind of designer! One focuses on indie cap, the other communal art
Democratic Social Space
Meaning, critique, basis for new cities?
Constitution, equal/unequal power dynamics, African Americans, new immigrants
Wealth makes everyone equal in City Profitable? Many left out. Mapping wealth
Effects of Fordism? Possible for Rivera, though socialist; not for Chaplin
Black Bottom? Segregated neighbourhoods by policy and attitude
Housing issues, Sojourner Truth, even as "unity", break gendered spaces, factories could achieve Rivera's dream, but do not, mayoral election
Suburbs are not, but are mapped that way: tension; for white ethnics, prev. working class, shaped by race, gender, and family, Highway Act and sprawl
Uprisings reaction to being left out and oppressed to allow it; Rivera's dream not allowed by racism and policy, Kerner Report finds failure
How does this operate when racial, economic divides? Gendered spaces blurring, Urban renewal projects
Megastructures only if $$, HP attempts to take back (not everyone supports!)
Forgetting Machine
North American settlements break from Euro past
Toqueville, African Americans, new immigrants
After WWI, rural past, new immigrants?
Not for Rivera--remembering machine!
Cannot forget race; Great Migration not working to escape racism
Break from Depression, win war, factories, unity
Suburbs as this! Try to forget war, crime, fear of bomb
NO, memory of wrongs and attempts to reverse
Forget city even exists, or responsibility to it
City more a memory machine!
Abandoned Difference
True for all? Or different power structures? Mass culture
Similarities among Gatsby characters?
Fordism, Melting Pot?
Race prevents this
Migration to work in factories, but housing issues
Becoming white, Imagined middle class, reinforces white middle class and decentralizes others
Does not exist here--Kerner points out distinctions
Not among different races, classes, ages

Urban culture w/o city
Stronger, workers (Cohen), movies, shops
Migration creates mc, working-class, black, immigrants
People move around, more common urbanized culture
Culture urban--rock and roll, though TV moves to suburbs
Motown as urban culture even as middle class whites flee
Shift to suburbs, but new stuff urban--hip hop, etc.
Gentrified culture of youth more based in urban ID
Batman Conundrum
Longing for rural past/draw to city
Chaplin longs for simple (new immigrants, workers)
Move, but culture still urban, miss city
Fear of city among outsiders increases, though most white middle class left
Miss city, loss of culture, sense of homogeneity in peripheral
Longing for city due to placelessness, homogenity
City Beautiful v. City Profitable
Public beauty (Moses), history v. private, $ (Gatsby, skyscrapers)
Rivera combines; Chaplin profitable eating soul
Segregation profitable for real estate, banks, government
For war, but sense of unity like Rivera (though not quite), expansion of bureaucracy
Suburbs profitable, homogenous, Highway Act and sprawl
Areas not profitable left by city and investors to people's detriment
Generally homogenous, meant for profit, urban renewal projects
HP v. Megastructures (though HP economic potential and Megastructures intended to revamp)
Producer v. Consumer
5$ Day supports both
Suburbs based on consumerism, Northland
Production moves to non-union areas or out of country, based on consumerism
Produce art in a consumerist culture
Creative Destruction
Consumerism, City Profitable, at expense of production
Unity v. Uniformity
Chaplin sees city as uniformity, deadening; Rivera as unifying, community
Black Bottom v. blacks moving into white neighbourhoods; whites keeping "others' out
War, factories go for unity, but race riots, housing projects; Rivera's flawed dream, mayoral election
Uniformity--look same, make homoegenity, don't know neighbours, what Chaplin wanted? Fight Cold War with uniformity rather than WW2 unity
Both seem to fall apart, though attempts at unity among Black Power advocates, Kerner Report attempts unity, fails
Uniformity in decentralized suburbs
Megastructures, neo-lib uniformity, placelessness of cities, HP unity among neighbourhoods, Rivera
Cumulative Causation
Reasons for protection of segregated space 1920s-1940s
Depopulation, deinvestment, deindustrialization, housing, police brutality, suburbs at expense of city
Futurama
Depression, but future friendly, tech good
Not gleaming city, had to leave
Reagan's City on a Hill, Morning in America
Builds on 1935! Tech advancements
Lonely Crowd
No unity, fear of others, homogenity, everyone is "Designer" in the same way, life might end immediately anyway (bomb)
Detachment from community and city, walk away from Omelas
Homogenity, detachment
City Peripheral
Expansion of suburbs, decentralization of political and economic power, public support of private investment, gendered blurring after women's lib
